results.title: Joey runs away (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Paul R. Gagne and Daniel Ivanick
results.brief_description: Joey, a young kangaroo, tired of his mother’s complaints about his messy room in her pouch, decides to run away. While Joey searches for a new home, word gets around that his mother has an empty room. What follows will entertain children of all ages. Based on the book by Jack Kent.

results.title: Joey
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and Graham Parker
results.brief_description: He was a likable seven-year-old boy, but he had been abandoned by his parents. He was first placed in a foster home; later, new parents were found for him. Joey is a story of adoption as seen from the child’s point of view. Made with the cooperation of the Children’s Aid Society, the film shows the measure of success that adoption authorities are experiencing today in placing older children.

results.title: Joe Petit Boum-Boum
results.brief_description:
Joe has saved the royal beehive from being vandalised by a gang of nasty children. As a reward, the Queen invites Joe to visit her royal palace. Reduced to insect size, Joe embarks on the exploration of the bees’ tiny kingdom.

Credits: Director, Jean Image ; writers, Jean Image, France Image ; photograhy, T. Tchikine ; music, Michel Emer.
Cast: Laurence Badie, Roger Carel, Chritiane Legrand, Linette Lemercier [voices only].

results.title: Joe Leahy's Neighbours
results.brief_description: Joe Leahy’s Neighbours is a film of truly compelling interest, one of the greatest documentaries made in Australia in recent years. Fashioned from the material shot by Bob Connolly and Robin Anderson during an extended stay in the Papua New Guinea highlands, it presents a portrait of a society only slowly adjusting to the demands of a modern world - a society caught between ancient tribal loyalties and the sharp business practices of the twentieth century. Rated: G

results.title: Joe Jacobs: stone carver
results.creator_credit: BT Film-Sound, National Indian Arts and Crafts and Geoff Voyce
results.brief_description: Documentary on stone carving. Joe Jacobs found he had a talent for carving after an accident in the building trade by using simple hand tools to depict his American Indian heritage.

results.title: Joe and the sleeping beauty
results.brief_description: The Queen Bee, Honeyflower is placed under a spell by One Sting Maude, a witch from the tsetse family, jealous of the Queen Bee’s beauty. Bzz, the Bee-guide enlists the help of Joe to help save the Queen. He is given an injection to shrink him to the size of an insect and enters the parlour of the sleeping beauty, Honeyflower. Written by Frame and Jean Image with music by Michael Emer.

results.title: Joe's party
results.creator_credit: TVA Group Production and Holman Brothers
results.brief_description: Joe is having a party with his family, in a hospital bed, having nearly killed himself in an accident at work. Industrial accidents are invariably caused by failing to exercise care or not observing recognised safety precautions. Shows examples in a stone quarry, but the warnings apply to many industries.

results.title: Jobs for the girls
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Suzanne Davies
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the ways in which young girls are influenced when choosing a job or career. A young woman careers officer describes the factors which affect firls’ attitudes at every level - school, college, and work, and sequences illustrate her statements.
